key_topics: Optional: Big O or efficiency analysis
Optional: both searching and sorting algorithms
Foundations Logic and Proofs: Propositional Logic, Predicates and Quantifiers, Introduction to Proofs
Induction: Mathematical Induction, Strong induction and well-ordering, Recursive algorithms
Relations: Representation and operations, Closures, Graph and paths
Modeling Computation: Languages and Grammar, Finite State Machines
Number Theory: Divisibility and Modular Arithmetic, Integer representations and Algorithms
Counting: binomial coefficients, permutations, combinations, partitions

Discrete probability: Events and random variables; Conditional probability, independence; Expectation, variance, standard deviation; Binomial, poisson and geometric distributions; law of large numbers
Optional topics from graph theory: paths, components, connectivity, Euler paths, Hamiltonian paths, planar graphs, trees
